      • readUntil

        public boolean readUntil(java.io.InputStream in,
                char ch1,
                char ch2)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: HTMLReader
        Test Accepts an instance of an InputSteam and two char's as parameters. Consumes characters from the InputStream and stops when either a character that is the same as either of the other two parameters is encountered (ignoring case).
        Specified by:
        readUntil in interface HTMLReader
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to consume.
        ch1 - First char to compare.
        ch2 - Second char to compare.
        Returns:
        If the character is the same as ch1 the value true is returned; otherwise, false is returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • skipSpace

        public char skipSpace(java.io.InputStream in,
             char ch)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: HTMLReader
        Accepts an instance on InputStream and a char as parameters. Consumes up to and including the first non-whitespace character on the InputStream or up to and including the character parameter.
        Specified by:
        skipSpace in interface HTMLReader
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to consume
        ch - char to evaluate
        Returns:
        Smallest possible value of a char, if the method stopped reading characters because the char parameter was encountered. Otherwise returns the non-whitespace character that was read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readString

        public java.lang.String readString(java.io.InputStream in,
                          char ch1,
                          char ch2)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: HTMLReader
        Accepts an instance of InputSteam and two chars as parameters. Consumes characters on the InputSteam and stops when either a character that is the same as ch1 or ch2 is encountered, not ignoring case.
        Specified by:
        readString in interface HTMLReader
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to consume.
        ch1 - First char to compare.
        ch2 - Second char to compare.
        Returns:
        String containing the characters that have been read in-order, if the character encountered is the same as the first char parameter. Otherwise if the terminating character was the same as the second char parameter, returns special String value null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
